articles.description: The power of the “big six” clubs over the Premier League has been severely weakened after the humiliating collapse of the breakaway European Super League this week.Richard Masters, the Premier League

articles.title: Liverpool and Manchester United owners apologise following European Super League collapse - ABC News
articles.description: The owners of Manchester United and Liverpool are forced to apologise to fans and their own clubs for signing up to the failed European Super League, as fans celebrate the collapse of the breakaway competition.
articles.content:
Clubs involved in the failed European Super League plan have publicly apologised to their fans and staff for their involvement in the controversial proposal.

articles.author: Tony Connelly
articles.title: Govt will resist changes to EU treaties - RTE.ie
articles.description: The Irish government will resist any move to change the EU treaties as a result of the upcoming Conference on the Future of the EU aimed at reforming in the European Union, according to an internal government memo seen by RTÉ News.

articles.title: Football: Time ticking for Man Utd's Ed Woodward after European Super League failure - CNA
articles.description: Manchester United executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward failed in his high-stakes gamble to join a European Super League and the clock is now ticking on his tenure at Old Trafford.

articles.author: Sporting News
articles.title: ‘They wanted more money’ – Dosu Joseph suggests the idea behind European Super League - Goal.com
articles.description: Florentino Perez has claimed an English club that initially committed to join the Super League "infected" others involved in the project with their disinterest, ultimately causing the project to fall apart.

articles.author: AFP
articles.title: Premier League clubs 'unanimously' reject Super League plans - New Straits Times
articles.description: LONDON: The 14 Premier League clubs not involved in the proposed European Super League “unanimously and vigorously rejected” the plans at an emergency meeting on Tuesday.
